intro: Hepetis consimilis, commonly known as the similar hepetis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks.
